transportAdvice: Johannesburg is a sprawling city where walking between attractions is generally not practical due to distances and safety concerns in many areas; most visitors rely on metered taxis, private hire vehicles, or guided transfers. A bus rapid transit system operates across parts of the city and connects some tourist areas, though renting a car or using pre-arranged transport is often the most convenient option for getting around.
